text: The Inter-Korean Liaison Office () was a joint office of North Korea and South Korea located in North Korea's Kaesong Industrial Region. The building was a de facto embassy and gave a direct communication line for the two nations. It was headed by North Korean Representative Jon Jong-su, vice chairman of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of the Fatherland and South Korean Representative Chun Hae-sung, vice minister of the Ministry of Unification. The four-story office building was destroyed by North Korea on 16 June 2020. It had been empty since January due to the COVID-19 pandemic. ==References== Category:2018 establishments in Asia Category:2018 establishments in South Korea Category:Establishments in North Korea Category:June 2020 events
title: Inter-Korean Liaison Office
